reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is approx 9 years old and located' on the beach'.10 /15 mins drive from Ferrengi beach,the main tourist area.Shops bars and atms 5 mins away in one direction.This establishment was clean and in good decorative order.Restaurant has good sea views.breakfast very good RM15. Delux double room had great sea views.clean and tidy,furnishings adequate and in reasonable order.No evidence of insect infestation.Room service good.Pool is average size and appeared to be clean.Beach is a narrow strip of white sand and although public,is very quiet.Staff raked it in the early morning.The Hotel has no alcoholic bar due to Islamic custom. The staff were polite and attentive. This Hotel will suit singles and couples looking for peace and quiet. ok for families who have transport and can get up to the busier parts.
reviews.title: Value Hotel with beach location on Penang.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a most enjoyable stay here. Beautiful views and a lovely room. Breakfast was very good and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is a pool at Naza Talyya and it'is right on the beach. The local bus stops just up the road outside the Chinese Swimming Club so you can travel to Georgetown or Batu Feringghi easily. Just across the road from the hotel is Viva Food Court with a great variety and at good prices.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Chinese food court, just 50 m from the hotel gate offers a wide choice of mainly Chinese cuisine. However, for a wider choice of food, take a 10 minute stroll to the nearby Tesco Mall.
reviews.title: Average hotel, desolate location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose it because it was much cheaper than downtown hotels of the same quality. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room clean and spacious and the food decent and reasonably priced. There was an open air food place just opposite and a pretty beach which we had almost to ourselves. Although it was some distance from the city centre, there was a regular, cheap and dependable bus service (101) that went right past - 2 ringgits for a ride. Taxi was generally about 20. It was nice after a day exploring the heritage sites to be able to relax by the pool or stroll along the beach. Apart from the 'food heaven' place, there was nothing much to do around here in the evenings - so we tended to stay late in the city. Buses kept going until late so we were fine with that.
reviews.title: A restful place by the sea

reviews.text: I went to this hotel as suggested by my colleage. The price is reasonable compared to other overpriced hotels in Penang. Most of the hotels in Penang are in the town and jam-packed areas, this hotel is a refreshing one as it is not in the middle of town, just at the outskirt of the town. Thus you don't really have to listen to all the chaos, just peace and quiet. The location is good as it is still near to beaches and tourist spots. It is also near to malls and hawker stalls. If you love beaches, this is the place to stay as it is so near to the beach, and it has a large swimming pool as well. The breakfast buffet is moderate with different choices of food. However, I was expecting that the hotel would serve popular local food like char kuey teow, laksa penang and so forth. The room is clean and comfy. The front desk people were friendly. During the durian season, this hotel sells durian outside of the hotel to cater to local tourists' urge to have durians as they are not allowed in the hotel. Really recommend this hotel for other people.
reviews.title: Best Hotel For Family and Beach Lovers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lot of the negative reviews here appear to be misleading,inaccurate and bordering on review abuse.As an ex uk hotelier who has recently stayed at the naza hotel,i can find no evidence to support many of these uncomplimentary reviews.
reviews.title: reviews for Naza Hotel Georgetown

reviews.text: I loved The Naza,also loved the location.After a night in hot,smelly,busy,dirty Georgetown i retreated up the coast to The Naza,good move cos i caught a bus to G Town each day to do biz.There is an excellent chinese food court opposite called Viva,cheeap too.Dont forget Tesco mall 7 mins walk along the highway.I swam every day in the sea outfront of the Naza,also in the pool,never saw any jellyfish in 9 days,but under the right conditions,jelly fish are there apparently.
reviews.title: The Naza is great

reviews.text: I am currently staying here for 2 nights (checking out tomorrow). So far it is OK. This is my second stay here. My previous stay was a few years back in their 2 bedroom suite. Currently I am staying in their Superior Room (1007).
reviews.title: Real Value for Money!

reviews.text: We booked 3 rooms and I had requested for an inter-connecting room with a set of twin and king bed room. Plus the third room as near as possible. Upon entering the rooms I found all to be twin rooms. I called down to ask for 1 king bed, to be told that the Superior rooms are all twins only. This was not communicated to me in the hotel's response to my request for a set of twin and king for inter-connecting rooms.
reviews.title: A fairly decent budget hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are pretty nice for the price, renovated and modern. I like the wooden flooring since it gives me the feeling of warmth and cosiness. Each has a small balcony. A pity that the balcony doesn't have any chair+table. But it is too small for that anyway, The view is nice. Since the beach in front of the hotel is like a bay all rooms have sea view. But I feel the rooms facing the Chinese Swimming Club have nicer view. The only issue is no floor mat is provided, only towels so the bathroom floor gets a bit wet.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: The Tanjong Tokong Beach is nothing to shout about. Penang beaches are generally pretty bad in comparison to the east coast's islands. However, I still prefer this beach to Batu Feringghi, which IMHO, is over-crowded and over-commercialised. Just this morning while I had my breakfast I had the pleasure of seeing a small fishing boat pretty close to the beach casting their fishing net.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Value for Money

reviews.text: Tanjong Tokong is also not too far from George Town. Unlike Batu Feringghi, Thus, no issue for us to go into town for meals or shopping. It is a mere 5 minutes by car from Gurney Drive. We even took the bus from the main road in front of the hotel to Gurney Drive's hawker center (RM1.40). There are a few upscale shopping malls nearby as well as a Tesco Hypermarket. There is also a hawker center right in front of the hotel. Also, a nice cafe next door with pleasant outdoor seatings above the beach.
reviews.title: Hot air cond in room 807

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights. Breakfast buffet was fantastic.
reviews.title: Good value, good service, friendly staff
